channel.title: Posts on B101nfo
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on B101nfo

item.title: PhD selection
item.description: students <- 1000 probability <- rbeta(students, 5, 5) inteligence <- rnorm(students) grades <- rnorm(students) plot(inteligence, grades) Now we supose that the grades are based on the inteligence grades_inteligence <- grades+inteligence plot(inteligence, grades_inteligence) Now we can simulate some other variables problems <- runif(students) problems_with_students <- grades_inteligence-problems plot(inteligence, problems_with_students) df <- data.frame(inteligence, grades, problems)

item.title: PCA and MDS
item.description: Many has been said about the relation of PCA and MDS. For instance this, or this other one on the practical point of view, however it has been different. In R we have on base (really stats package) three functions: prcomp, princomp and cmdscale We will compare the outpot of the three of them on this dataset: set.seed(547913) x <- runif(100) M <- matrix(x, ncol = 10, nrow = 10) prcomp stats:::prcomp.
